name: rest-api-practice
description: - If you use macOS, in your terminal, typed "cd/" - It will go to "/ borlandtien$" (your home based on your personal computer's name) - Then "mkdir data" or "sudo mkdir data" (force to make a directory - named data) - ["mongod --dbpath data/"](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/tutorial/install-mongodb-on-os-x/#specify-the-path-of-the-data-directory) - When you see "[initandlisten] waiting for connections on port 27017" - which means MongoDB has started successfully
